sudokuGame

Class Evolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudokuGame.Evolution

  • public class Evolution
extends java.lang.Object
    Evolution engine that responsible to search the player (individual) who can solve the sudoku board. This class let the players (individuals) try to solve the sudoku board, if at least one succeed then the program will end if NO one succeed to solve the sudoku board then it will evolve the next generation, to try solve the sudoku board... etc Since the program should NOT run forever the program will stop evolve new generation after reaching maxGenerations of attempts. While we trying to solve the sudoku and evolve new generations, we log some information into report file (.csv file) with createReportFile and writeGenerationData methods, the report will created in reports directory. In this class we manage the main flow of the program.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Abedalrhman Nsasra
    See Also:
    Population, CSV_Writer, Genetic Programming

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int maxGenerations
      Max of attempts to create generations that will try to solve the sudoku board until we quit trying.
      private Population population
      Represent the players (individuals) that trying to solve the sudoku board
      private CSV_Writer reportGenerator
      We use it to logging the evolution progress into report file

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Evolution(Population population, int maxGenerations)
      Initialize the fields of the instance, and determine the max attempts to generate new generations that trying to solve the sudoku board before quit trying.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void createReportFile()
      Create a report file with current time name (CurrentTime.csv), and append to him the headers and some basic initial information of the experiment parameters like: Original Empty Cells, Population Size, Max Generations Crossover Probability, Mutation Probability, Primitive Set, Terminal Set...
      void evolve()
      evolve method is the heart operation of the engine, in this method we search the player who can solve the sudoku board, and if we find him we stop the engine and show the solution, and if we don't find a one who can solve the sudoku board, then we generate a better new generation, and repeat the search...etc We repeat this operations until we reach the max allowed attempts, and then quit anyway, since we can't run forever.
      private Individual getBest()
      Gets the best player (individual) that have lowest fitness, player with lowest fitness is the player that have the lowest amount of empty cells before he could NOT progress without having conflicts in the board solution.
      private Individual getWorst()
      Gets the worst player (individual) that have highest fitness, player with highest fitness is the player that have the highest amount of empty cells before he could NOT progress without having conflicts in the board solution (a kind of loser).
      private void writeGenerationData(int gen)
      Append the current generation data into the report file: generation number, best individual's fitness, best individual's fitness, average fitness, best individual's tree-based GP as infix and prefix expression.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Evolution

        public Evolution(Population population,
                 int maxGenerations)
        Initialize the fields of the instance, and determine the max attempts to generate new generations that trying to solve the sudoku board before quit trying.
        Parameters:
        population - represent the collection of players (individuals) that trying to solve the sudoku board, this instance can generate the next generation
        maxGenerations - is the max allowed attempts to create new generations that will try to solve the sudoku board

    • Method Detail

      • getBest

        private Individual getBest()
        Gets the best player (individual) that have lowest fitness, player with lowest fitness is the player that have the lowest amount of empty cells before he could NOT progress without having conflicts in the board solution. In other words the best individual is the one who progressed the most. We need the best player in this class only for logging and create the report file.
        Returns:
        the best player (individual) at the population in the current generation

      • getWorst

        private Individual getWorst()
        Gets the worst player (individual) that have highest fitness, player with highest fitness is the player that have the highest amount of empty cells before he could NOT progress without having conflicts in the board solution (a kind of loser). We need the worst player in this class only for logging and create the report file.
        Returns:
        the worst player (individual) at the population in the current generation

      • evolve

        public void evolve()
        evolve method is the heart operation of the engine, in this method we search the player who can solve the sudoku board, and if we find him we stop the engine and show the solution, and if we don't find a one who can solve the sudoku board, then we generate a better new generation, and repeat the search...etc We repeat this operations until we reach the max allowed attempts, and then quit anyway, since we can't run forever.

      • createReportFile

        private void createReportFile()
        Create a report file with current time name (CurrentTime.csv), and append to him the headers and some basic initial information of the experiment parameters like: Original Empty Cells, Population Size, Max Generations Crossover Probability, Mutation Probability, Primitive Set, Terminal Set...

      • writeGenerationData

        private void writeGenerationData(int gen)
        Append the current generation data into the report file: generation number, best individual's fitness, best individual's fitness, average fitness, best individual's tree-based GP as infix and prefix expression.
        Parameters:
        gen - is the generation number that we reach, and it's the row number that we append
